passage_text: 1 Rare breeds can fetch prices as high as $50 per dozen. 2  DuckEggs.com offers a two minimum-order, all-inclusive packages available to anywhere in the continental US. 3  Package 1 consists of 18 fresh duck eggs for eating while the second package includes 9 pieces of fertile hatching eggs. 1 Ordering two or more of any package at the same time can bring down the price to $49 each. 2  Packaging and shipping costs are already included. 3  At Salmon Creek Ranch in Bodega, California, jumbo duck eggs will cost $1

How much should I sell duck eggs for? I sell my chicken eggs for 3.00 a dozen with good success. Can anyone help? Any advice would be much appreciated.... Thanks... Tes. $5.00/dozen locally(VERY RURAL) but take a drive to the farmers market in the city and they sell for $12.00/dozen. If you want to be happy for a year, win the lottery. If you want to be happy for a lifetime, love what you do.. Democracy is two wolves and a lamb voting on what to have for lunch.

For eating $10/ doz or 0.50 each. I don't sell for hatching since I have a mixed flock. There are few if any mass producers of duck eggs and they are in demand, low supply big demand means higher prices. Check your state rules, usually you don't have a lot of rules if selling person to person. Originally Posted by FunnyBunnies12. I'm overloading on duck eggs, I have 8girls laying and I have about 8 dozen eggs in the fridge, how much do your charge for your duck eggs.

I don't personally get enough duck eggs to sell, but family is now taking all I can get. There is a vendor on the local farmer's market here in Pontiac, Michigan, that sells duck eggs for $5 a dozen. He sells regular brown non-organic eggs for $2 and organic brown eggs for $4. Originally Posted by FunnyBunnies12. I'm overloading on duck eggs, I have 8girls laying and I have about 8 dozen eggs in the fridge, how much do your charge for your duck eggs.

A dozen chicken eggs currently cost approximately $1.61. (Cage-free eggs cost twice as much.) There’s no nationwide data on the cost of turkey eggs—the USDA doesn’t even have grading regulation for turkey eggs—but many producers sell them for $2 to $3 per egg. Turkey eggs used to be a menu staple in North America.

Are They Expensive? Duck eggs are quite a bit more than chicken eggs, but still not prohibitively expensive. Whereas the average price for a dozen chicken eggs is somewhere just north of $2 in the U.S., duck eggs will usually run you anywhere from $6 to $12 a dozen.

Duck eggs are a lot more nutritious. I sell a dozen for 5 dollars and a half dozen for 3 dollars. I have ducks, chickens, geese, and quail! I am looking to get pigeons, peafowl, guineas, and much more! Originally Posted by FunnyBunnies12. I'm overloading on duck eggs, I have 8girls laying and I have about 8 dozen eggs in the fridge, how much do your charge for your duck eggs.

Plus, eggs offer an entry-level price point – a new customer may be willing to spend $5-$6 for a dozen eggs, but its a much harder sell for a $20+ chicken, for instance. As for the fertility value, we can affix a bit of a price to that as well, though it doesn’t really encompass everything the chickens do and add. While commercial layers may top 300 eggs per year, I don’t think our birds reach that, since we have standard breeds as well as hybrids, who aren’t cooped up in a cage with no room to move… I figure about 250 eggs in the first year, and 150 in the second, for a total of 400 eggs, or 33 and 1/3 dozen.

1 Package 1 consists of 18 fresh duck eggs for eating while the second package includes 9 pieces of fertile hatching eggs. 2  Both packages cost $54 and come with no extra shipping fees. 3  Ordering two or more of any package at the same time can bring down the price to $49 each. 1 Ordering two or more of any package at the same time can bring down the price to $49 each. 2  Packaging and shipping costs are already included. 3  At Salmon Creek Ranch in Bodega, California, jumbo duck eggs will cost $10 per dozen.
